content:
I'm thinking about advocating for either.
a) Change the name of the "Full HTML" text format to "Raw HTML"
b) Adding Backup and Migrate to Core

Input and opinions welcome.
a) should be fairly simple, so once it's done you can then advocate for b) :smiley:

a - seems like a lighter lift, but resolves something I find to be a fairly serious problem.
b - seems like a flashier option that will get more attention, but also requires a lot more work (and might be controversial)

StPaulTim said:

I'm thinking about advocating for either.
a) Change the name of the "Full HTML" text format to "Raw HTML"
b) Adding Backup and Migrate to Core

Input and opinions welcome.

We've had to create a text format that does not allow ckeditor and is strictly code and does no filtering (think scripts like constant contact forms, etc.. That's what I think of when you say Raw HTML. Full HTML format does strip out some tags and is not source code to end users. I think it would create confusion.

@Elisabeth Garbeil - If you have thoughts on the validity of that idea, please post them in the issue. So far, I think we have general consensus on the goal, we are still working on how to implement it. https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4499

[UX] Change the name of the "Full HTML" text format to "Raw HTML" 路 Issue #4499 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
This has been discussed elsewhere, but I can't find an issue that focuses attention on this potential fix to what I think is a serious UX bug, so I opened this issue. Description of the bug Cal...

StPaulTim said:

Elisabeth Garbeil - If you have thoughts on the validity of that idea, please post them in the issue. So far, I think we have general consensus on the goal, we are still working on how to implement it. https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4499

Done.
